issue.title: Fixes #2289 adds a bodyMultipart function to the request builder

repository.name: playframework
repository.description: The Community Maintained High Velocity Web Framework For Java and Scala.

issue.body:
# Pull Request Checklist
- [x] Have you read [How to write the perfect pull request](https://github.com/blog/1943-how-to-write-the-perfect-pull-request)?
- [x] Have you read through the [contributor guidelines](https://www.playframework.com/contributing)?
- [x] Have you signed the [Lightbend CLA](https://www.lightbend.com/contribute/cla)?
- [x] Have you [squashed your commits](https://www.playframework.com/documentation/2.4.x/WorkingWithGit#Squashing-commits)?
- [x] Have you added copyright headers to new files?
- [x] Have you checked that both Scala and Java APIs are updated?
- [x] Have you updated the documentation for both Scala and Java sections?
- [x] Have you added tests for any changed functionality?
## Fixes

Fixes #2289
## Purpose

Adds a bodyMultipart function to the RequestBuilder
## Background Context

Actually inside the bodyMultipart there needs to happen a blocking call, since Helpers.route doesn't accept any CompletionStage / CompletableFuture value.

issue.title: Injectable default body parsers

repository.name: playframework
repository.description: The Community Maintained High Velocity Web Framework For Java and Scala.

issue.body: The body parsers in `BodyParsers.parse` should have their configuration and materializer injected rather than using the global application.

body:
This is more of a documentation issue (tagged the issue as such). @marcospereira you are correct that this is already technically possible. I think the main documentation for custom action builders is here: https://www.playframework.com/documentation/2.5.x/ScalaActionsComposition#Custom-action-builders

Previously we suggested people define action builders as objects/methods inside controllers, but there are a lot of benefits to injecting `ActionBuilder`s as well.

We have some documentation in the Play REST API paper for the tech hub, notably in the `PostController` that takes a `PostAction`:

https://developer.lightbend.com/guides/play-rest-api/part-1/index.html

issue.title: Make clear that action composition can use Dependency Injection

repository.name: playframework
repository.description: The Community Maintained High Velocity Web Framework For Java and Scala.

issue.body:
## Fixes

Fixes #5815.

## Purpose

Most of the documentation was already updated with examples using Dependency Injection. This just add some small points to make it more clear and complete.
